sentences.en: Experiencing things yourself is the best way to acquire perceptual knowledge.
sentences.cn: 亲身体验是获得感性认识的最好途径.

sentences.en: For her bright and limpid eyes, for her perceptual warped lips.
sentences.cn: 她有明亮的眼眸, 和微微翘起的嘴唇.

sentences.en: Formal abstrction is based on images or perceptual things.
sentences.cn: 形式抽象的基础是形象或经验世界.

sentences.en: His death is very rational, at the same time very perceptual.
sentences.cn: 张自忠的死是十分理性的, 同时又是十分感性的.

sentences.en: Its perceptual cause is dadaism and the rational one is structuralism.
sentences.cn: 达达主义,它是促成装饰绘画立体化的感性原因.构成主义,它是促成装饰绘画立体化的理性原因.

sentences.en: More generally, people's perceptual and filtering processes create misinterpretations.
sentences.cn: 更一般的是, 人们的感知和过滤过程会产生错误理解.

sentences.en: One is perceptual appearance, and the other is reason appearance.
sentences.cn: “丽”在唐宋时期美学视野中呈两种特质:感性和理性互有并存,共具一代.

sentences.en: Some children come to school with more finely trained perceptual skills than others.
sentences.cn: 一些孩子在入学时比其他孩子受过更好的感知技能培养。

sentences.en: Some children have more finely trained perceptual skills than others.
sentences.cn: 一些孩子比其他孩子具备更为训练有素的感知技能。

sentences.en: Substantial bitrate reduction is achieved while maintaining the same perceptual quality.
sentences.cn: 在保持相同感知音质的情况下,它可以大幅减小编码比特率.

sentences.en: Suit neuter to slant perceptual skin uses Gan Jimin.
sentences.cn: 适合中性偏干及敏感性肌肤使用.

sentences.en: The discovery of abnormal pre - seismic phenomena, a great leap in perceptual knowledge.
sentences.cn: 震前异常现象的发现具有极高的科学价值, 是感性认识上的重大飞跃.

sentences.en: The so - called knowledge has been always confined to perceptual and intelligent levels.
sentences.cn: 而 所谓 的知识,也就始终被局限在感性的和悟性的两个层次上.

sentences.en: The subjective judgment of perceptual experience has its otherness and different combinations.
sentences.cn: 既然是主观的知觉经验判断,固然存在着知觉的差异性与不同的组合性.

sentences.en: When multiple saturated colors are used together , chromostereopsis and other perceptual artifacts often occur.
sentences.cn: 当使用多种饱和色时,经常出现多彩立体影像和其他视觉假象.

trans.tran_en: Perceptual means relating to the way people interpret and understand what they see or notice
